FuncDef:
The traffic-analysis udp identification block command configures the number of blocks in a UDP flow to be intelligently analyzed.
The undo traffic-analysis udp identification block command restores the default configuration. The traffic-analysis udp identification block command configures the number of blocks in a UDP flow to be intelligently analyzed. The undo traffic-analysis udp identification block command restores the default configuration. By default, a UDP flow is divided into 256 blocks for intelligent traffic analysis. This command is supported only on the CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE8850-SAN, CE6885-LL (low latency mode), CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P and CE8850-HAM.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of blocks in a UDP flow to be intelligently analyzed.
The options are as follows:
48163264128256
The default value is 256.
